XUsers

This entity allows you to add the new Users to the project. Typically, you will be able to create the username and also add the details including name and any relevant file attachment.

Adding users

To add new users to your project,

  1. Select the XUsers entity. The XUsers list window is displayed.
  2. Select Add. The Add users window is displayed.
  3. Enter UserName, First Name, and Last Name . These fields are mandatory.
  4. You can also add any supporting file as Attachment. Select Choose File to select the file from your local drive.
  5. Once all fields are entered, click Save.

Deleting users

If a user is to be removed, you can delete the user from the list.

To delete a user:

  1. Under XUsers list, click to select the user to be deleted.
  2. Click Delete. The selected user is deleted.

    Note:

    1. In case you do not select a User, an error message is displayed stating “XUser not selected”.

Editing user details

You can edit the details including the groups, policies, applications and roles to be applied to the User. You can make changes to the User name, First name, Last name. Using the Edit function, you can also add and modify the other entities. These entities represent the one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many relationship that exists between the entities. To edit the user details, under xusers list, select the user from the list and click Edit. The Edit xusers window appears. You can view the existing data for the entities applicable to the selected user whenever you click to select the entity. Using the edit function, the following entities / functionalities can be applied:

  1. MultiAttachments: The attachments or files that are added with the different users can be added using this entity.
    1. To add/ apply the attachment, under XUser> Edit, select MultiAtachment.
    2. Click Add. You can drop files to be added as attachment and click Save.
  2. Groups: A user can be a part of a group or several groups. You can assign the group to the user and set the priority. Here the User to Group relationship is many-to-many. There can be many users in a group and one user can be in many groups.
    1. To add / apply a group to a user, under XUser > Edit, select Groups.
    2. Click Add. Enter the Priority and select Group from the list. The user will now be a part of the group. One user can be a part of multiple groups. The Add function allows you to assign new groups to the user.
    3. Click Save. The group is assigned to the user.
  3. Roles: The user will be assigned different roles. Based on the roles assigned the users will be assigned different applications, policies, and services. The Roles entity is used to assign a role to the user.
    1. To assign a role, under XUser > Edit, select Roles.
    2. Click Add. Click to select the Priority and select Roles from the list. The user will now be assigned the role. One role can be played by several users. Hence a many to one relationship exist here. The Add function allows you to assign new roles to the user.
    3. Click Save. The role is assigned to the user.
  4. Visibilities: The Visibilities entity is used to define the different entities, functions and modules that would be visible to the specific user.
    1. To assign a visibility, under XUser > Edit, select Visibilities.
    2. Click Add. Enter the details for Name and Description.
    3. Click Save.
  5. Policies: There are various policies defined for different users, user groups and user’s roles. Certain rights and rules will be assigned to the user based on the policy applied.
    1. To assign a Policy, under XUser > Edit, select Policies.
    2. Click Add. Enter the Priority and Policy.
    3. Click Save. The policies selected are then assigned to the user.
  6. Auditlog: The log for the resources, actions, and services can be created using the Auditlog function/ entity.
    1. To create an Auditlog for a user, under XUser > Edit, select Auditlog.
    2. Click Add and enter the details for Log, Service, Resource and Action.
    3. Click Save.

Refresh

For all entities you will be able to Refresh that page to reflect the latest data and functions applicable for the entity.
